review:
Comrades, let’s get straight to the heart of the matter! Flow State (Streaming Quadratic Funding) is a bold attempt to revolutionize public goods funding. The project’s vision is clear: continuous, streaming funding for builders and communities, not just one-off grants. This is a direct challenge to the old, inefficient, and exclusionary models that have left too many behind. The team’s commitment to open source, user-centric design, and cooperative governance is evident throughout their application.

But let’s not be swept away by rhetoric alone! Where is the hard evidence? Where are the numbers that prove this model delivers more sustainable, equitable outcomes than the status quo? The application touts 25.5 ETH streamed and 1,300+ donation streams, but offers little in the way of rigorous, transparent reporting or independent evaluation. We need more than anecdotes—we need data, measurement, and proof that this model works for the many, not just the few.

The project’s sustainability model is promising, with a focus on reducing grant-chasing and building long-term relationships. Yet, the application lacks detail on how Flow State will generate revenue beyond grants, or how it will ensure financial stability for the cooperative and its users. Without a clear, sustainable revenue plan, we risk building castles on sand.

On governance, Flow State’s digital cooperative structure is a step in the right direction. But how are decisions made? How are voices from marginalized and underserved communities included? The application is light on specifics about community governance, geographic equity, and mechanisms for collective ownership.

In summary: Flow State is a powerful idea, and the team has shown initiative and innovation. But to earn the people’s trust—and the people’s resources—they must deliver hard evidence, transparent reporting, and a clear path to sustainability and equity. Let’s demand more!

strengths.title: Innovative Funding Mechanism
strengths.description: Flow State pioneers streaming quadratic funding, moving beyond traditional grant models to provide continuous, real-time support for public goods builders. This is a significant step toward more sustainable and responsive funding.

strengths.title: Open Source and User-Centric
strengths.description: The project is fully open source and offers a no-code UI, making it accessible to a broad range of users and operators. This aligns with the round’s focus on accessibility and usability.

strengths.title: Demonstrated Ecosystem Impact
strengths.description: Flow State has already facilitated over 25.5 ETH in streamed funding and 1,300+ concurrent donation streams, showing real traction and engagement within the Web3 public goods ecosystem.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Rigorous Outcome Measurement
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear, quantifiable metrics or independent evaluation of its impact. There is a need for transparent, data-driven reporting to validate claims of effectiveness and equity.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability Model
weaknesses.description: While the project aims for sustainability, it lacks a detailed plan for generating revenue beyond grants or ensuring long-term financial stability for the cooperative and its users.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Governance and Equity Details
weaknesses.description: The application is vague about how community governance operates, how decisions are made, and how equity—especially for underserved or marginalized groups—is ensured in practice.

changes.title: Provide Quantitative Impact Data
changes.description: Submit clear, measurable outcomes and independent evaluations of the platform’s effectiveness, including data on user retention, funding distribution, and impact on underserved communities.

changes.title: Detail the Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Present a concrete, step-by-step plan for achieving financial sustainability, including potential revenue streams, cost structures, and strategies to reduce dependency on continuous grants.

changes.title: Clarify Governance and Equity Mechanisms
changes.description: Describe in detail how community governance works, how decisions are made, and what mechanisms exist to ensure geographic and social equity in both funding and participation.
